impact-statement: A combination of phylogenetic and biochemical analyses suggest that some unexpected variations in the synthesis of isoprenoids may be widespread across all three domains of life.

competing-interest.conf1: The authors declare that no competing interests exist.

aff2.dept: Jack H Skirball Center for Chemical Biology and Proteomics

aff1.institution: Howard Hughes Medical Institute, Salk Institute for Biological Studies

contribution.con1: ND, Conceived and completed the project including all experimental designs and implementations, deep phylogenetic analyses under the supervision of Gerard Manning, analyzed all data, drafted the complete article, and revised the article in response to reviewers’ comments
contribution.con2: STT, Carried out the measurements of the pH-dependent thermostability of MPD, carried out steady-state kinetic measurements on purified MPD with its initial affinity tag removed, and edited near final versions of the article
contribution.con3: GM, Instructed Nikki Dellas on methods and interpretations of deep phylogenetic analyses described in the article, carried out computational methods described, provided an evolutionary context for the article, and together with Nikki Dellas drafted the initial article and edited the initially submitted article
contribution.con4: JPN, Directed the project including experimental planning with Nikki Dellas, assisted in data analysis, interpreted data, drafted sections of the article together with Nikki Dellas and provided editing at all stages
